intro: Carruanthus caninus, commonly known as the dog's mouth or dog's tongue, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters. Carruanthus caninus is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
